newsitem.title: GERMANY: Rapeseed output sharply lower in Europe-Oil World.
newsitem.headline: Rapeseed output sharply lower in Europe-Oil World.

text.p: The European Union rapeseed crop was likely to fall to 6.9 million tonnes in 1996 from last year's 8.2 million and from 7.3 million initially projected for this year, the independent Oil World newsletter said.
The publication said latest news of German and Austrian losses reflected a lower area and weather-induced yield problems.

Oil World gave the following country-by-country estimates -- France 2.72 million tonnes (2.78 in 1995), Germany 2.20 million (3.10), Britain 1.18 million (1.24), Austria 130,000 (260,000) and Denmark 250,000 (320,000) tonnes.
It said crops in Finland and Sweden should also be lower but French yields had turned out much better than expected and Spain's crop should also be higher this year.

EU exports to Poland, which suffered sharp output losses due to winter kill, were expected to pressure domestic EU supplies and rapeseed crushings were seen falling by 1.4-1.5 million tonnes in July/June 96/97 from eight million in 95/96.
Oil World said there would be temporary mill stoppages and these would curtail the availability of domestic oil.
But EU oil stocks are still very high, an analyst said. --Vera Eckert, Hamburg newsroom, +49-40-41903275
